newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila SEC sets rules on backdoor listings.
newsitem.headline: Manila SEC sets rules on backdoor listings.

text.p: The Philippine Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) issued new rules on Tuesday to regulate the takeover of dormant listed companies through so-called "backdoor listings."
Several companies in recent years have simply taken over dormant firms listed on the Philippine Stock Exchange to secure a listing without going through the lengthy process of registration.

The SEC said in a statement that companies which want to take over dormant or inactive corporations wiill have to make a tender offer to all stockholders of record at the same price being offered to major shareholders.
A notice of the tender offer will have to published in a newspaper for two consecutive weeks.
The SEC also ordered the PSE to revise its rules for companies to keep their listing on the exchange, setting such levels as a minimum number of trades or minimum corporate turnover.
